page.title: 13PENTLAND HOUSE, PENICUIK
page.content: { This home for{old people}was opened in 1976. There are about{40 staff, including 4 senior officers, domestic and care staff and a shift system is worked. There are{49 permanent {residents,}9 men and 40 women as well as an emergency bed and 2 beds for "holiday care". Residents can take part in classes in{art, keep fit, {macrame and handcraft}and they can get their hair done. The library has large print books. There are 15 toilets and a{Medicbath}which has a little door and residents can bath sitting on a chair. The full cost of a weeks stay is Â£240 of which residents should pay Â£157.
